Reviews.Title: “not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Barbara B
Reviews.Content: It was the only vacancy we could find, and we felt ripped off. Towels were like sandpaper, the bathroom didn't have any hooks or towel rods, hot and cold fixtures were reversed in the flimsy fiberglass shower, and the deadbolt didn't work. Room 603 was a big efficiency with king sized bed, fridge, and microwave, but size isn't everything. At least it had tile floors.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced shoe box”
Reviews.Author: ani03
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small, so if you're expecting a big room you'll be very disappointed. WAY OVERPRICED, musty, humid rooms with wall unit a/c's. Had to request fresh towels every day, minimal housekeeping. Pillows were so flat they felt like doormats, oh and let's not forget the huge parrot cage nearby the rooms that would not shut up. If you're expecting continental breakfast, yeah right, another disappointment. If I were to price this hotel, it would be about $79 a night, not almost $300. Another thing, if you're claustrophobic you won't be able to take a shower, my closet's bigger than the shower. One person barely fits in there. Overall, huge disppointment.

Reviews.Title: “WE had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: butch a
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at Ibis bay and had a great time. It is not Marriott, but all you really need is a place to sleep and take a shower. Clean, very clean, rooms and beds, pool area and the food at the Stoned Crab, is excellent. Do yourself a favor and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Didnt not what to expect”
Reviews.Author: Stacy G
Reviews.Content: I was very hesitant after reading all the reviews about this place. I decided we were staying in Key West and didn't really have to have all the extras since we would be out and about having fun. Me and my fiance decided to go ahead and try it. We came to Key West to get married. Our wedding was amazing. I am so glad I did it here. As far as the resort, our room was 514 right in front of the restaurant and the squauking parrots. They did wake us up every morning very early. The room was extremely tiny for 2 people. Had no place to put clothes. Had to leave them in suitcase. There was no bathtub and shower was tiny. Hardly had room to move in there. I asked for a iron and ironing board. The staff brought me one but was to dirty to even use. I wasnt about to put my clothes on it. You only get one towel a piece. There was one day that we didnt get clean towels until 7:00 that evening. Had to ask twice for them. This place is no resort. It is more of a motel. We ate at the Stoned Crab restaurant the first night we got there. The food was nothing special but we were tired and just wanted something to eat. Service was very slow. We got told at front desk that you get 10% off meal but the waitress conveniently forgot to do that. She acted like she was stoned herself. The concierge was no help. He actually got rude with my husband. We had a great time in Key West. I am so glad I came here to get married but I will never stay here again. We made do since we had already paid for it through bookit.com. We are already talking about coming back to the Keys but will definitely do more research before booking again. There are so many more nice motels and actual resorts there to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing motel-feel on Route 1”
Reviews.Author: JMM-TravelCT
Reviews.Content: I booked this as a special through Expedia because they offered a suite with fridge and coffee maker for $188 per night. I was a bit concerned about the negative reviews, but thought that most were pre-renovation and hoped for the best. The location is right on Route 1 before you get into Key West, with lots of neon signs and chain drug/other stores around. There is NO Key West atmosphere at all; it has all of the charm of a roadside motel in New Jersey. The room was terribly laid out. It was actually two rooms, one of which was quite large with an old, dirty convertible sleeper couch. When I called and said we needed the couch made up into a bed all they did was drop off some shabby sheets and leave them on a chair. Really? For a resort? I had to spend one night on it and my back still hasn't recovered - the springs were broken and prodding me everywhere. The next night my son chose to sleep on the floor instead. Apparently this room was renovated but if so they wasted their money. It had a cheap, outdated feel. The pool is a mediocre rectangle surrounded by motel rooms. The one nice thing was the restaurant, which does manage to have a nice atmosphere and decent food. People actually bike from Key West to this hotel for the food. If you are going to take the trouble to drive all the way to Key West, stay someplace IN Key West with some atmosphere. This place is not it.

Reviews.Title: “i'm laid back..and it was just fine for me!”
Reviews.Author: debdie h
Reviews.Content: i read all of the reviews, and was skeptical, but when i got there, the staff was great, the rooms are nothing special, but suited me just fine. the food was amazing at the stoned crab, and the drinks were just as good! i had no problem with it.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cannytraveller2008
Reviews.Content: After booking 2 nights here the reviews on TA just got worse and worse but we had non-refundable booking so were stuck and the prices of hotels in Key West are ridiculous. Paid Â£260 / $290 for 2 nights to sleep in a very small room, also had to pay $10 resort fee on arrival. Sleep perhaps not really the right word as the parrots woke us up at 5.30am and traffic on road beside hotel was very noisy. Had paid for courtyard room but no other room available. Hotel is almost 3 miles from Duval Street so you either walk, hire bikes or get taxi as parking is really expensive and difficult to find. At least hotel has free parking. Room was clean buttiny - one queen bed, two bedside tables, two chairs at bottom of bed under wall mounted tv. No drawers or wardrobe so had to live out of case. Bathroom had toilet, basin and tiny shower. Bed sheets and towels were threadbare. No wi-fi in room, had to get signal at reception lobby or restaurant. Pool area with sun loungers but have to use room towels as no extra towels provided. Restaurant on site and meant to get 10% off food and free drink with meal but they conveniently forgot about that when they brought our bill. Free coffee at breakfast time but only in hope that you will buy breakfast in restauran.t. In UK I would compare this to a 60's holiday camp/motel and have had better quality in Â£19 per night Travelodge. I realise prices are dearer in Key West but thought this was very poor value for money

Reviews.Title: “Not a resort, but a motel”
Reviews.Author: Brunette1234
Reviews.Content: Very outdated bathroom. Little parking. 10 minute drive to duval st.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good!!”
Reviews.Author: 31rustyc
Reviews.Content: Well- I did read reviews.. too late, but it couldn't be that bad.. WRONG!!! Asked for a renovated room.. It must of been renovated 15 years ago. Couldn't get in shower w/o closing the bathroom door..No Fan so very hot!! Sheets so thin you could rip them, you actually can see through them!! The 100% best part of the place is the restaurant/bar!! The staff was great!! Not much else good to say! No Beach.. Pictures on there web sight are very, very deceiving!!! No closet, dresser, no where to put clothes.. Kept them in suit case!! Air Conditioner was saving grace!! It drowned out the noise of the other rooms!!Plus the construction around the place!! I know the owner is new and he has redone alot of stuff, but he definitely needs to address the rooms.. It by no means should have resort after its name!! would never stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place to Stay on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: FLSailor17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I slept in Room 520 for 2 nights. It had a King bed and fresh paint. Clean and nice upon check in. Small but adequate for the price paid. The A/C worked great. The bathroom although small was fine, it had a toilet, a sink and a shower--no frills, no bath-tub, no hair dryer but no problems either. The bed was comfortable if you like a mattress on the firmer side. No problems with it for us. The pillows on the other hand were lousy--we hijacked two from friends staying at the Fairfield Inn then returned them when we left. We did NOT step foot in any of the facilites, although we would have gone to the on site bar if It was open. We tried at 10:45 PM on Saturday night. I couldn't tell you what amenities there were--we were there to see KW. Not terribly far from the downtown area and I thought it was convenient to everything, if you have transportation to get around. In my opinion, I have stayed at the Casa Marina, the Southernmost B&B and several other places in KW so for the price--room 520 was exactly what I expected it to be--a clean room, decent bed to sleep on, and way less than the other places. Did I mention we were there to see KW and not the hotel? From 7 AM to about 11 PM we were out in the thick of things seeing the sights and having a blast--the Ibis was a place to sleep, brush teeth, shower and prep to go again. That was the expectation and that is what we got. The money saved was spent dining out and having a ball! Yes, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, ads misleadingSay refurbished, not even close”
Reviews.Author: Justretired2012
Reviews.Content: Ads claim refurbished , some paint, beds covered in plastic. Very old uncomfortable is a misstatement .noisy ac, bathtub moldy.two rooms. Would have left if able to find other accommodation.door old locks one key not working , large gap under door. Patio door no lock, plastic pipe in track . Parking lot holes, one entrance blocked frequent ly. Sun Sentenial how could you give this a good review!!! Place is disgusting at any price

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: SeattleLibrarian
Reviews.Content: If you are going all the way to Key West, do yourself a favor and stay some place closer to Duvall St (the "downtown" area). This place has an amazing website that makes it look like a beach front resort. This is by no means a resort and the "beach" was not an accurate description of where we were. Plus, the water smelled horrible. The rooms we got were beyond tiny and hot like an oven (we were there in January). We didn't get wi-fi (advertised on multiple travel sites) in our room and when we complained we were moved to the "waterfront" rooms. The rooms we were moved to were larger but still didn't have a dresser or a closet, the seating consisted of cheap plastic patio furniture and the beds were small and uncomfortable. The bathroom was a little scary. There were holes in the floor where tiling had not been completed and the grout looked like it was 50 years old and in bad need of replacing or strong bleaching. The food was decent at the restaurant but service was horribly slow. The front desk staff were helpful in moving us and the activities guy was very nice and helpful. Honestly, we would have left if we hadn't prepaid (with no refunds).

Reviews.Title: “This place needs to be torn down.”
Reviews.Author: yayalady
Reviews.Content: This was our first and LAST hotwire experience. Thanks goodness we refused to stay in the first tiny closet sized room we were first given. It overlooked a courtyard of construction with big equipment moving rocks around. We were upgraded to a view of the bay because we freaked out. The room was clean but very sad. The bed felt like a piece of foam. We also always request a King size bed, but were told hotwire only issues queens. The beds however, were regular size pieces of foam. Pushing a few rocks around in the courtyard is not going to help this place. The location is awful. Parking in key west is VERY expensive and you are not close enough to walk to downtown. We could have found a nicer place on our own closer in. There is no way I would could consider this place a Resort. It's only redeeming feature is the Stone Crab Grill that is attached. The food and service is exceptional. Also don't expect internet service except in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Barely Adequate and Not Close To Beach or Duval Street.....”
Reviews.Author: haringdr27
Reviews.Content: Mixed reviews is my opinion. Believe all the mixed reviews cause there true. Based upon what you are expecting and what your needs are Pros: cheaper then most hotels on KW, mini fridge upon request, decent tv, basically clean, bike and scooter rentals on location, big 24 hour Albertsons supermarket and liquor store across the street, decent pool and bar. Cons: it's not walking distance to beaches or Duval St, bed was not too comfortable, pillows were lousy and cheap, hot water takes forever, tiny bathroom, noisy guests next room(not hotels fault) loud either construction truck or early garbage pickup. The owners have a decent place and try so I give them credit. I rented a bike off site at A&M bike rental, picked me up at airport and dropped me off. The main problem is the distance to the beach and uncomfortable bed. I would have sprung an extra $150 for the 3 nights and stayed closer. This hotel isn't worth more than $100 a night cause of the cons. Expect to pay the extra anyway for cabs or scooter rental. That's really the bottom line. You'll pay more for transport anyway so stay closer. This hotel wouldn't be my first choice but not my last either, hence the tripadvisor rating towards the bottom.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: Debbie D
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised! Upgraded our room with no problems. Wonderful old Florida flavor. The staff was excellent. As was the restaurant, especially breakfast. Although Taxi & shuttle service was readily available, suggest driving a car. About 10 min. from Duval by car. The pool area was clean and the water sparkled. Very laid back and relaxing. Our room looked out to the water and you could be very content to just sit on the beach and read a book all day. There is a Quick store across the street and a small strip mall with a grocer just walking distance away. Also close to the airport. Check out Krawl off Duval. It is a craft beer and fine wine bar. The owner/service was exceptional. Had never visited Key west before and enjoyed every moment. The music, the food, the museums.....everything......great time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “"ok"”
Reviews.Author: MissMika
Reviews.Content: Pros- Clean, nice pool area, cute outside dining Con's - Squawking parrots and birds in cages outside our hotel room at the break of dawn, room had no amenities (had to go to desk to request a blow dryer, no iron in room, etc)

Reviews.Title: “Started out a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: coreynb
Reviews.Content: They started us out in this room around back under the stairs where there was no parking close to your room.Everything was painted this ugly blue color. No pictures on wall or anything! Outdated TV. Tiles on floor was mismatched colors. Bathroom vanity was this old dirty looking wood color that looked like it had blood spots on it? Bed was a full size bed, almost setting on the ground! Old mattress that was hard to sleep on! Only reason we slept there was because of the long drive, and we where exhausted! The next morning we complained and they explained they where remodling And gave us another room which was 10 times better! The resort had 2 giant turtles in enclosure in middle of parking lot. Iguanas running around everywhere. They would come drink out of the pool while you were swimming. Parrots caged up next to the restaurant on the property. Giant sand sculptures that where outside the room we were moved to, blocking our parking spaces. Luckily there where couple of motorcycle guys in room beside us that didnt take up to much space! The resorts resturaunt wasn't nothing special but highly priced! They gave you coupon for free adult drink and $25 off stone crab claws. Your thinking wow! They advertised for having stone crabs and made it sound like best thing ever but after trying them once there I'll probally never try them again! They were not good by any means an highly priced! Over all stay after switching room was ok! I will more than likely consider staying somewhere else if I ever return to Key West tho! Feel we could have been treated better for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Very cool fun funky place to stay in the keys for a reasonable price!!”
Reviews.Author: Tiffnenoel
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay an extra night in KW and our current hotel was booked so we got a Hotwire deal here. We were very pleased! Private waterfront beach with hammock right off our patio. The coral walls in the room were super cool as well and the full size washer and dryer was a nice bonus. I'm sure not all rooms have the same as us and we just got lucky through at last minute Hotwire deal. But the staff was very helpful and friendly. The restaurant on site The Stoned Crab was excellent and the free drinks and 10% discount was an added bonus. The pool area also offers a "dive in movie" which is neat too. Also there's wildlife everywhere from the tortoises and the macaws to the ibis and iguanas. If we were here for more than one night I would have liked a dresser in my room and a mini fridge. But that's the only drawback. It's a ways from downtown but half the price of staying downtown too. I'd definitely recommend this place !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Stephen R
Reviews.Content: After reading everyoneâ€™s opinions about Ibis Bay, allow me to share mine. As an inline hockey coach, I'm always looking for road trips to play against other organizations. We decided to take our 10U and 8U teams to Key West and play a 7 game schedule. I started to contact all the hotels/motels in the area and the only one that went above and beyond to accommodate our organization (around 50 people) was Ibis Bay. Everything was taken care of. The check-in went without a hitch because the staff had everything set ready to go. There was one room that wasn't ready so the staff upgraded the family to a 2 bedroom suite without hesitation. The kids and parents all had a great time. We would like to thank the management team and staff for their courteous, friendly and professional attitude that they displayed during our entire stay. We will be backâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: tbos
Reviews.Content: Will, in guest services, was awesome. The only down side to the place was location. 15 min bike ride to Duval. What it lacked in location was made up for by friendlyness. I'd stay again

Reviews.Title: “A little better than expected- fairly priced for location”
Reviews.Author: jefkes
Reviews.Content: First let me tell you I'm a seasoned traveler that has stayed in a wide range of accommodations from a canvas safari tent in Africa to Motel 6's along the I-5 and 101 corridor and even Four Season's Resorts. Each of these places have their purpose and market segment. And so its true with the Ibis Bay. I booked this place for a guys week in Key West to celebrate my brother turning 50. I wanted Key West weather within striking distance of Duval via cab. I did not want to spend $400 per night for a room we would only spend 6 hours a day in. Upon arrival the cabbie told us.."this place use to be a dive but an Australian Gazzilionaire bought it and has been dumping money into it ever since." Well he dumped it in all the right places. Within minutes of opening our door housekeeping stopped by to see if we needed anything. We forgot and opener. She produced one in seconds. We ate at the Stoned Crab for lunch, breakfast an dinner over the course of our 6 day stay and it was all delicious and fairly priced with great service. Rooms were slightly better than expected. Everything you need for a stay in the Keys. The folks complaining about this properties age or room size were either unwilling or unable to pay the extra $200+ per night to stay within stumbling distance of Duval or they can't read a map. And guess what? I've stayed and the Hyatt at the end of Duval and the rooms are the same size. The Ibis is exactly what we needed and expected for our trip at a fair price for it's location and current renovation state. I can't wait to go back in two years for my 50th to see what they've done with the place. Pros: Gets you in Key West for half the price of places near Duval. That buys a lot of cabs, food and mojitos. Walking distance of Albertsons and K-Mart. Cons: No hot tub. Pool unheated. Sliding glass door to our room was past its service life and even though bathroom was remodeled it needed a higher wattage light. Suggestions: Spring the extra money for waterfront otherwise parking is on both sides of your room. You want to leave the sliding glass door open for sea breezes

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to key west over new years eve”
Reviews.Author: meow88
Reviews.Content: We paid 220 dollars for a room at this resort Because it was new years eve. The room was really worth 70 dollars. We would not stay here again Even if it was cheap It's far from town And a taxi cost us 20 dollars!

Reviews.Title: “Your Average Hotel...not disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: curlgurl2007
Reviews.Content: When looking to book a room in Key West, I struggled to make a decision on which simply because there are so many mixed reviews out there. (Not just for this hotel but with many.) I wanted something cheaper, clean, and that basically got the job done. We stayed for a weekend and weren't expecting the Ritz. I settled on Ibis Bay at $125 a night through Hotwire as their 2 star option. I was satisfied with the Ibis and happy we picked the cheaper option. Here's what I thought: We got room 407 (a handicap room, not that we asked for one). It was simple and small, but clean. There were zero bugs like some other reviews claimed. (I even checked the corners of the bed for bed bugs.) Only a queen bed and a dresser fit in the room, but it was do-able. The bed was extra kooshy which I loved being that I'm 6 months pregnant. There was a TV that looked about 15inches from 1990. A dryer, but no mini-fridge. The air-conditioner blocked out any outside noise not that there was much. Checking in was quick and easy. We'd already planned out our own trip (which is easy due to this site and the internet) before coming so we skipped the 'fun desk' aka the info desk. There was no WIFI and cell service was dodgy all over the island. We got a drink at the restaurant, but next time I'd skip it because it was pricey even during happy hour. I did enjoy all the Ibis birds wondering around the place (the tall white birds). We brought our own car so the 2.2 miles to the heart of the island wasn't an issue. So all in all I was happy with our experience. I rated it 3 stars because to me that is an average rating. I expected average; I got average. I think some people just have too high of expectations and if you're like that you should shell out the extra money to begin with. For the price (in comparison to all the high prices in Key West) this was fine for me. Would I stay here again? Maybe. About Key West: This was my first trip down. Here's what you can expect. No beaches. The Key's aren't known for their beaches, don't expect ANY AT ALL. Go to Miami or the Bahamas if you want beaches. (I knew that going in so there was no disappointment.) I hear there's great snorkeling/diving/jet skiing/other water sports, but in January it was just too cold for that. (72ish for our trip, but the water's still too cold for me.) Plenty of good restaurants/bars. Plenty of tourist type shops. Plenty of friendly people and beach music. Getting around is easy if you have a car and meter parking wasn't too hard to find. I think I'd get bored if I stayed longer than a couple days during the colder months...I'd recommend Mar/April perhaps when you can do more stuff in the water. Hope this was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: havnfun2012
Reviews.Content: Im going to be simple, I found this hotel to be horrible: The room was tiny, the furniture was beaten up in the room, found spiders on the walls and ants in the sink, the room had an odor, the beds rolled and 1 of the 2 made really loud farting type of noises when you touched it or sat on it, the shower itself was not washed down (we found soap dried), the towel hanger came right off the wall, there was hardly any cell service in the room and the WIFI would not come in,the front door also creaked every little movement it had,and there was no furniture to put your stuff on. The "fun activity" lady did not help in finding something to do for adults and a teenager at night, the information we got was: it was the city that never sleeps. We asked where to go to find the nicest beach and we got sent to the beach we couldnt swim in because the mud was gross in between our toes and we didn't want to feel that.This lady also was no help in finding our way around, she just circled where about something may be on a map they give you.Only one car is allowed. The liquor was very expensive, they filled the glass with ice and put very little alcohol in it for $8 and it was not very good. The room I was in had a glass door with chairs right outside looking at cars and a road, we did not get to see the water front right from outside the room. The positive things about this hotel was that they had parrots and a couple turtles as animals for everyone to see, the staff around the parrots were nice and brought out celery to feed them. They had a sand art area with a beautiful sculpture. The water front had an ok view, you can't swim in it. They had chairs out there you could sit on which was nice. There was no free breakfast and the location of the coffee in the morning was hard to find, we ended up having to go to the store and buying some there. The pool was decent. There was nice birds walking around too that was nice to see. The price was good for the Key West. I personally suggest paying a little more and going to another hotel. I was extremely dissatisfied with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too many other options in KW to waste money here”
Reviews.Author: prs2007
Reviews.Content: As a scuba diver, my expectations while on a dive trip are pretty low. We generally just want someplace to clean/dry our gear and catch 40 winks before we dive back in the water. On the other hand, for all my other travel, I look for 4-5 star places with white fluffy robes and lots of amenties. I usually spend the last week of the year in KW as a relaxation/sun trip. This year I added 3 days of scuba diving with a group who booked the IBIS thinking it was a 'resort'. Unfortunately, it is not. It is a 2 star motel trying to reinvent itself. Slowly...painfully...and not successfully. Our group had 3 different rooms so we could 'compare' what we were in against the rest of the group. We were shocked at the conditions. Dirt, grime, mold, chipped/missing tiles, no closets, no phones, and in our case NO ROOM KEY! We went a full 36 hours without a room key and relied on the hotel front desk to 'let us in' everytime we returned. They had to have a local locksmith make a key for the room. The pool is fine. Nothing to write home about. But it is clean and has a decent area around it to sunbath. It is close to the 'bar/restaurant' but we never saw them 'deliver' to the pool or even come by to take drink orders. We always had to go into the bar and order and then go back and pick it up to take to the pool. The bathrooms are small and bad. Rust, mold, missing/chipped tiles. In 1 of the 3 rooms, the shower stall was so small you had to practically step out of it to bend over and shave your legs. Seriously. Housekeeping is fairly bad. We never saw them before 2 pm and we ended up just asking them not to clean and requesting towels from the front desk. Our room was fairly large but no closet or dressers. You live out of your suitcases - literally, and your suitcase lives on the floor since there is nothing to put it on. The restaurant is ok. Food is 3 star but pricey. They are very slow. The two times we ate in the restaurant we waited 20+ minutes to order and another 30+ minutes for the food to arrive. Even poolside it took 40 minutes to get a burger. Finally, it is located a $10-15 taxi ride from Duvall. Look up the Douglas House as an alternative at about the same price break but much better run and kept place.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for key west”
Reviews.Author: Esaffran
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were down over Chirstmas and had a nice time. The best parts of the resort would be the price, pool, and the 'beach' area. Don't think that you can swim in the ocean/gulf as it is just a lagoon type area that is not fit to swim in bit there were chairs to sit and sun yourself There is a nice pool but you can't bring in outside food or beverages- and the food at the restaurant is overpriced and the service is rather surly. Also, there was nowhere to sit inside or outside the room. One last complaint was the bathroom. It was outdated and the toilets didn't flush 'for poop'. But it was pretty quiet considering it was on US 1.

Reviews.Title: “Dissatisfied...”
Reviews.Author: PaigeK607
Reviews.Content: My friends stayed here and invited me and my other friends to Visit them. this place was disgusting and the restaurant was over priced. Ewww, I would never stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a bit of fine tuning”
Reviews.Author: Ozbird59
Reviews.Content: Still a bit of work to do to warrant the price of the rooms. Head house cleaner was excellent but her staff are not so great. Rooms are supposedly refurbished but the light and extractor fan in our bathroom were broken, there was no wardrobe, the curtains to the patio were frayed and filthy at the bottom. Outside there were not enough tables and chairs and there was bird crap everywhere, they came and cleaned it the first time we mentioned it but it needs to be done daily. The bar/restaurant staff were great, the pool area was good but overall you should get a much higher standard for these prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: wonyoung
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great for the price. If you are expecting a 4-star hotel quality room, you might be disappointed. The staff was kind and helpful. The room and bathroom were a bit small, but it was good enough for us. We weren't spending much time in our room anyways, so my wife and I just wanted a cheap room that was decent enough. I think Ibis bay met our standards very well.

Reviews.Title: “These reviews are correct but read them all”
Reviews.Author: Jim W
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of this place after Hotwire landed me there. Hotwire gives it a 2-star rating which is fair. The discount rate was about $50 less than what I could get elsewhere in town. They put us (my dad and I) into a single king bed room which had been renovated. It was sparse and decently finished. This room is what all of the people who liked the place must have stayed in. I asked to be moved to a room with two beds and that is where all of the negative reviews came true. The room had not been upgraded since likely the 1990's. The floor was a really odd and dirty looking tile that the beds rolled on when you sat on them. The TV was a 19" (while the king room had an LCD) and the remote didn't turn the set on or off. As someone else wrote in their review, the room had a musty smell which I figured was back flow from the shower (no tub) and after running water it wasn't as strong. The "Beach" area is a sand box bound by armour stone. The wifi was only in common areas and if you angled your laptop just right. This site is at the edge of town and no where near the action. The staff were nice. The restaurant ran out of chicken wings at 8pm so instead I got the "Turk" and I would recommend it but the restaurant has a unique atmosphere for the side of US1. Spend $50 more and go elsewhere or if all you want to do is crash then the Ibis Bay resort is worth the 2 star price you paid.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: yandry
Reviews.Content: Good service, very nice place, if you have children this is a good place for them, they have animal,

Reviews.Title: “would not stay again (amenities fee and location)”
Reviews.Author: luv2fly2
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights 12/6,7,8/11 Booked with Priceline total 267.75. When checking in we were charged $10 per night PLUS TAX. Making the room cost over $100 per night and it really wasn't worth it. It has been remodeled but the location is not near Duval or Mallory Square or the beaches. There is no phone, clock or coffee maker. There are 4 hangers on a hook on the wall but no closet.I had to go to the laundry room and ask for a hair dryer. We went to the office which is the only internet service area and we had a very difficult time getting on the internet. We did not use the pool or restaurant. It is the most basic hotel that I have ever staying in. We did get housekeeping service everyday. While we were in the office trying to connect to the internet a couple of customers came in to check in, they tried to decline the amenities fee because they were there for work and didn't need the pool, restaurant or internet but they were told it was not an option. I would not stay there again because it was not worth the extra 32.25 amenities fee.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Sarah S
Reviews.Content: We booked through an online tool, not knowing what to expect. The rooms were very clean. The bed was more comfortable than the one we have at home. The staff was extremely helpful, accomadating and pleasent. We had a great time and would definitely stay again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Value”
Reviews.Author: KMartin78
Reviews.Content: Ok Folks! If you are traveling on a budget, as I was, this is a fine place to stay. I recently flew to Key West last minute alone. The room is a place to stay! Hello.. you are in Key West. I didn't spend much time in my room. The room has a bed, tv with remote and a bathroom. The floor in my room was all tile. This would not be the ideal place if you are honeymooning and looking for frills. IT IS BASIC, but clean. It did not have a blow dryer or an iron. I didn't ask if you could get one from the office. Possibly? The staff IS WONDERFUL and fun! They can direct you on where to hangout etc. You can rent a bike or motorcycle from the lobby of the hotel. (approx. $75 bucks, cash or credit) I recommend the motorized scooter from the distance from Duval street.(about 3 minutes) It was fun too! The restaurant is a good place to chow. I will stay here again and recommend it to my friends. We are late 20's and early 30's. Reminds me of a "spring break" hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: MiamiTravelBug
Reviews.Content: The place is nicely renovated in a cheerful colorful style. I had friendly quick check in and then referred to a friendly concierge desk if I needed any tours or activities. I felt welcomed without any pressure to book anything. The room was clean, nicely decorated, but did smell musty. Maybe for not being used in a little while. That cleared quickly after the air conditioner was turned on. It worked well. This is a very decent place for 2 stars. Since I booked on Hotwire I was not informed of the exact hotel till after booking. Once I arrrived I was informed that I was about 2.5 miles from Duval St. Too far to walk. This was my main disappointment, but not the fault of the hotel. I feel it was a very good value for the price I paid. There is free coffee in am and 10% off restaurant bill for hotel guests. I did have breakfast there. Had the huevos rancheros which were prepared to my liking and very fresh and tasty. The staff at the restaurant (an outdoor covered cafe) were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Under the radar getaway”
Reviews.Author: GailW2011
Reviews.Content: We like low prices and great value. Ibis Bay Resort gave us a great Key West getaway with a waterfront room - not the greatest room, but adequate; not the greatest view, but pleasant - along with very pleasant pool and a decent hotel restaurant. Although the hotel sits right on Route 1, it's separated by a small canal so the environment is active but not horribly noisy. We spent a whole morning working at a restaurant table - with coffee coming whenever we asked - and thoroughly enjoyed our temporary office facility - complete with palm trees swaying in the warm breeze! I'd go back (though would definitely aim for a waterfront rather than parking lot room)

Reviews.Title: “Small, but clean”
Reviews.Author: Csettle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Ibis bay during the week of Thanksgiving. We booked our room through hotwire and got a fairly good rate. I read the reviews on here before our trip and was really unsure what to expect. The front desk staff was very helpful and got us checked in quickly. The resort is nothing fancy and I wouldn't consider it to be beachfront, however we weren't impressed with any of the beaches in Key West. The room was very small with just the bare minimum of a bed, tv, and small bathroom (shower only). The room we got was however very clean and it looked like it had recently been painted, and cleanliness is the main thing I look for when traveling. The pool deck was nice, but I wish they had a hot tub. We also ate at their restaurant, The Stoned Crab, twice during our trip. Once was for lunch and the other time for dinner, and both times our food was excellent with very large portions. They charge a resort fee of $10.50 which I don't thoroughly agree with since we wasn't provided with any sort of amenities. Overall, the resort is nice and I think that their website gives a fair description and accurate photos. We wasn't impressed with the area overall, but Ibis was a nice low key place to stay for a couple nights.

Reviews.Title: “best resort in key west!”
Reviews.Author: monica p
Reviews.Content: good service,nice people,beautiful and romantic honeymoon room!!

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Griffin D
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews on here I feel I have to give my version of events. I never write reviews but feel that the hotel has been unfairly called. The hotel was exactly as described and I found it to be very clean and quaint. Yes the rooms are on the small side, as are the bathrooms, but everything was clean on my stay, nothing was stolen and the front desk staff were helpful and able to answer any questions I had. We had a room on the second floor facing the parking lot. An issue to others maybe but as we were in Key West to see things and use the room for showering, changing and sleeping it really wasn't an issue. Plus we had less distance to go when carrying our cases! As we don't like to be disturbed on our holidays we left the Do Not Disturb sign on the door but the one day we forgot, we came back to find the maid had left fresh towels and toiletries on the bed and not touched a thing, despite the fact our cases were open and things were on the bed. The air conditioning is a little noisy but to be honest, I've rarely stayed in a place that is silent, especially with rooms that face outside so I had no issues there. The pool was clean and well laid out with plenty of sun loungers and eating in the restaurant was lovely as you could sit by the water and enjoy a nice drink and the tastiest Key Lime Pie we had all holiday. The walk to Duval street was about 30 minutes, so the hotel is based on the edge of town but the walk was easy with plenty to look at. Overall I really enjoyed my time at the Ibis Bay Waterfront Resort and was pleasantly suprised by the outdoor exterior and the cute, clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Ibis!”
Reviews.Author: Jazzmine N
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were so disappointed with Ibis Bar Waterfront Resort. The associate at the front desk was slow and careless and the rooms were worse. The room had a wet/mildew musk in the air, the bathroom was too small, and the bed was nasty. Our room was on the "beach" which was smelly, rocky, and brown. It is near a Fridays which shows how depressing this place is. Also Duval Street is pretty close by, which is a total waste of time unless you are over the age of 50. Overall there was nothing about this hotel that would make me want to recommend it or come back.

Reviews.Title: “great on the outside”
Reviews.Author: EastEndYay
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect- just far away yet close enough for Duval St madness as well as family fun at Smather's Beach or Ft. Zachary. You can actually bike or moped anywhere from here. The outside of the resort is wonderfully re-done (seashells instead of rocks in the parking lot areas, dried coral on the facade of buildings, brightly colored painted buildings) and it looks inviting. The pool area is wonderful and right next to the hotel bar & restaurant that seemed to always be open with good basic food plus some expensive options that we never tried. The resort owns some interesting animals that are fun to check out- giant parrots and giant turtles. There weren't as many families- it seemed to be older vacationing people so the vibe was relaxed and not chaotic. It was a great place to relax when we needed downtime in between vacation activities so on those accounts- I highly recommend it! The downside: the inside of the rooms. I was super disappointed that after we upgraded to a "water view room" there was no beach. It was on the water, but on a bay-front where it seemed to ALWAYS be low-tide. And if you've ever been to a beach or worse, a bay, at low-tide- the smell is horrific. Being that our room was right on the water, it constantly smelled like sewage even though we never opened the sliding glass doors because the stench was so bad. DO NOT REQUEST A WATER-VIEW ROOM!! If you do, bring airfreshener and candles. The bathroom was also sad as the lighting seemed like prison lighting. There was also only one mirror in the entire room which was the small bathroom mirror- which made it difficult for two people to get ready at once, or even one person really. There was no dresser or table or anything to put our luggage or clothing on or in. We requested a table which they told us they'd bring and they never did. We ended up leaving our clothes on the tile floors for the 6 days... we had no other choice. Basically, as long as it's a short stay so you have no need to put clothing away anywhere and you don't get a water-view room and you don't spend much time in your room... you'll be good! It was inexpensive so I'm not totally dissatisfied with my stay, I just think they need a few small improvements and the smell would have been my only negative remark.

Reviews.Title: “Lof of issues”
Reviews.Author: virtualGoat
Reviews.Content: Front desk was pleasent. But the room was filthy and the curtains in the room are semi-transparent. Did not feel that I had any privacy at all. luckily the AC was pretty noisy and the white noise help me sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice mini resort feel.”
Reviews.Author: tls0506
Reviews.Content: Currently renovating but it was not a disturbance in any way. Not a cookie cutter hotel which is what we like. Had 4 tropical birds, 2 huge turtles, iguanas, and huge sand castles. It is on the water too. Staff was very accommodating, food in restaurant was average. Nice pool area too. Great value for the rate. In trolley route.

Reviews.Title: “Recently renovated - not reflected in many of these reviews”
Reviews.Author: sebage
Reviews.Content: This place is not half as bad as many of these older reviews suggest! It has been tastefully renovated recently. Let's be clear - this is the not four seasons but you are not paying four seasons prices, people! Room was clean and staff were friendly. I didn't spend any time in the resort itself, just the room for a couple of night of nights. It's not located near the tourist areas of key West, so you will want a car. Or rent a bike. Try for a waterfront room, or you may get a carpark on either side. Handy for parking (!).

Reviews.Title: “TRY IT! YOU'LL LIKE IT! and you'll want to go back again”
Reviews.Author: TomandRitaNY
Reviews.Content: Whatever you do, do not go by the bad reviews of others. My husband and I stayed at the Ibis during fantasy fest Oct 27-31 we had a great time the entire time we were there. get yourself a scooter from the Fun Desk Guy Mike and you are on your way to all in a matter of minutes.The owner Chris,the location,staff,bar, pool and restaurant all lots of fun and had a great time. and Yes this is not a 5 star hotel but with renovations up and coming before you know it will be looking like a 4 star hotel. The rooms are neat and clean.the bathroom could use a bit more updating but that will come in time i'm sure. Hey Rome wasn't built in a day.You get a fun, warm, welcoming feeling from all the staff and the bartender ashleigh was bubbily and told us places to go while at duvaul street.Jason was a nice guy kept things in order and made sure your dining experience was a good one. food was okay. the stonecrab is a must thanks to the GM who does the crabbing.the Rum Cake,hot wings and burgers are delicious. my husband liked the keylime pie. entrees need a little help but they were good. John the magician/card trick guy was great. buy him a drink he was worth it.great location Duvaul st is a 10 min. scooter ride, to any fast food or department stores 5 min. ride.we had fun filming the sandmaster show with the travelchannel and watching prof. splash dive into the pool of 12"of water. that was great! i also was on a local radio station and won a pineapple drink w/free refills for the eintire day thanks Chris. The price was right but just a suggestion incorporate the extra $10 a day into the price. people see extra chrge its a turn off. I was dissappointed not having my frig or hair dryer in my room upon arrival as i requested but i just had to ask for it and they brought it right up. Suggestion..to Chris the owner please get water filtration system please! the water down in the keys is horrible as it is so that makes ice cubes horrible and that made us drink beer in which we'd rather have mixed drinks. you could be loosing lots of money because of that and this might hold me back in returning to the Ibis.All in All we had a great time and have fond memories of the locals and guests we met. Joe, kenny and CiCi from Massachuettes were lots of fun wish we could have said good bye. Cici you have my number call me. local guy steve from the little town in Ohio you were lots of fun sorry for interrupting your quiet time at the bar, you know us New Yorkers are loud and even louder being from Long Island and then you mix in some Massachuettes people well need i say more and you have to admit you had a great time cause you did tell your buddy Mike with the golden nugget. Hey Mike, quesa deche, gumba! take care and hope to see you all again in a few years. off to vegas next year. if we do well in vegas maybe we will be back in october again.

Reviews.Title: “You've been warned!”
Reviews.Author: KellyBeth
Reviews.Content: This resort has good prices compared to others and there is definitely a reason why! The bathrooms were absolutely disgusting, room was filthy and not at all what the pictures on the website portrayed. Good thing we brought beach towels because they only gave us 2 towels for 4 people in our room. We asked the front desk for more towels and they said they ran out. Ran out of towels! The maid didn't clean our room until we complained and asked them too and we had to ask 3 times for more toilet paper. There are only sheers on the windows so the sun pours in at 6:00 am and the mattresses are seriously uncomfortable. The locals informed us it was the only hotel on the island that ever had a shooting and the hotel is known for drug dealers and prostitutes. It looks like they are trying to clean it up but they have some serious work to do and some serious management problems. We had a good sense of humor about the whole situation so we dealt with it and made the best of it. I don't know how people give this place good reviews.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T DO IT....Fantastic location but that's it...”
Reviews.Author: michael b
Reviews.Content: Come on man! Seriously?! Parking lot on BOTH sides of the room? Parking lot 36 inches from the front door AND the slider doors next to the bed?! Come on man?! The sliders, I might add, that had what equated to a bed sheet that would not come close to covering the window?! By the bed? Come ON, man!! And how about the lovely 1989 wall unit air conditioner, with broken vents and nobs? I was back in the lobby in 5 minutes to tell them it was unacceptable, no refund on a "sold out" weekend. The staff lied and said i was in the room an hour. I WAS IN THE LOBBY waiting for the nerdy staffer to call the manager! Come on man! Don't be temped to stay here unless you plan to be unconcious when you are.

Reviews.Title: “don't believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: vikki1230
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean. The restaurant food is very good!!! The staff was helpful and courteous. Bathroom space is limited but definitely doable, we had 6 people in our room and did just fine! If you want extra towels they are limited, but ask for whatever you want, refrigerator, hair dryer, rollaway bed (small fee), microwave and you get it. We requested a waterfront room when we got there and early check in and got both. The pool area is really nice. The location is a long bus ride from down town and it's convenient to catch although it does not run frequently, that is the only down fall to staying here. On the plus side it is removed from town and gives you an escape from the crowds. Alot of the bad reviews were from before the renovations and the new owner is sprucing the place up daily. You can rent bikes or motor vehicles and they will bring them to you at the hotel and pick them up also. It is convenient to Kmart, Albertsons (great souvenir prices) and a liquor store, dollar store and pizza shop. All walkable. Don't forget to visit the Key West Tropical Gardens when there. It's a 6 min drive and so worth the time. Very peaceful, you can spend 1/2 hr or two if you wish. But be sure to spray with OFF supplied free at the admissions office before setting off. (it's only $5.00 for admission small price for the preservation it sustains). Save your bread from meals to feed the Ibis that will roam freely around the hotel. (but not obnoxiously) Enjoy the hammocks too! If you are looking for luxury then go pay the westin prices otherwise this is a great place for the money!!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: West Palm Beach, Florida, United States
Reviews.Title: “A Most Memorable Wedding !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: David N
Reviews.Content: We held our wedding reception and lodged our guests at Ibis Bay in April, and it was wonderful. When so many other places in Key West told us "this is the price, take it or leave it," the Ibis Bay folks promised "we will work with you" to fit what you want into what you can afford to make it memorable, and they absolutely did. Chris, the owner, attended us personally, and shared with us the vision of how he was renovating the hotel into a quirky, unique property worthy of the spirit of the Keys. We had 100 people for the reception along the waterside dock. The kitchen cooked up an amazing meal of Cuban food (especially the pork - yum!), and a beautiful breakfast spread the following day. The light-up sign in front of the hotel had silly messages about us all weekend. We stayed in the honeymoon suite, which was then pending renovation but which had a beautiful view of the sunset, and we hosted about 30 people (plus one chihuahua) in there the night before for an unforgettable evening. Thank you Chris and your amazing staff for giving us a reception that our friends and family are still talking about! PS - We plan on paying you a visit on our first year Anniversary =)

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Time”
Reviews.Author: JoeyNaples
Reviews.Content: Great staff, Great food again. We had a ball. BTW...My last review should have been 5 stars not 1.

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Angela R
Reviews.Content: We were expecting a medicore hotel when we arrived for the price we paid. However, what we found was appalling. When entering, the sanitation strip was placed on the toliet, but when I removed it and lifted the seat, something of the biohazard nature was lurking inside. Completely disgusting. I felt it would be ok to keep my toothbrush and toothpaste on the bathroom sink; however, a bug or mouse regularly excreted waste on the sink, soiling my toothbrush. The dark blue blanket on the bed had white stains. The housekeeping do not understand the do not disturb sign on the door and barged in when I was changing. This was my worst hotel experience. I will never think about staying here again and would advise others to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “awesome stay in the keys”
Reviews.Author: brad f
Reviews.Content: i really enjoyed my stay at the ibis bay waterfront resort at key west,i had a wonderful time there. your beds were the most comffortable beds i have ever slept on in a hotel. i love the exibit of animals you have on your property.... and what can i say about your awesome pool i loved it what pool should be closed at 10 or 9 pm that is the great thing about going to a hotel THE POOL and you guys leave it open all night great...your front desk staff were very friendly and very helpful.. your restraunt was pretty good i loved that u can sit outside over the water that was nice... your price was the best in key west....i will defenatly be coming back as a matter of fact i will be coming back this week cant wait to get there thank you for such a wonderful stay

Reviews.Title: “OK stay but updates needed”
Reviews.Author: Joanne1967_10
Reviews.Content: Some rooms are definitely larger than others, and mine was on the small side. The bed mattress was hard, tiny shower, and there were no amenities like clock, hair dryer, or phone to call the front desk. It looked like changes are being made to the facility as a whole (some rooms were being painted and there are flatscreen TVs). But it is an older resort that tended to seem dated rather than funky. The staff were very nice for the most part.

Reviews.Title: “good stay, lose the resort fee”
Reviews.Author: joeyandjeanne
Reviews.Content: so the wife and i stayed at the ibis for a long weekend. i have to say overall it was a good stay. the hotel is making alot of upgrades everyday. the 4 real parrots just outside our room was a plus, we found ourselves walking over and trying to have a conversation with them many times. ( sober & tipsy ) The room ( new room ) was small but clean and updated. nice lamps, tile, decor....ect. shower is small, very small... im talking cruise ship small. so be careful if your a plus size. no fridge in room.... but if you ask like we did.... poof .... few hours after we went out on the town ... there it was in the room and cold and clean. thanks to the very nice front desk staff. i walked over to the beach type area and they are fixing it up, it has potential. i also went to the pool one afternoon it was very clean and nice lounge chairs, but this is where i take points away..... you pay $ 10.00 per day resort fee... i went to the front desk to ask where the pool towels are located since there was only 2 bath towels in the room they said they dont have them. huh ??? kidding me right... i had to use my bath towels which get kinda sweaty and lotion on them... i even asked a house keeper if i can trade these out and she told me no she didnt have anymore to trade. the resort fee is a rip off. i asked many staff what it is for (wi-fi, parrot food, turtle food, ect.... ) they just said it is a mandatory charge and kinda shruged it off. do us all a favor and ditch the resort fee and just add it to the price of the room. when you have a resort fee you kinda feel you should get something for the money. YOU GET NOTHING !!! would i stay again.... sure if you ditch the resort fee... if you have an extra $10 per day to just make a fire and throw it in to burn then the motel is a great place to stay... if you dont then there are a half a dozen other motels within a half mile with the same service and ammenities with out the extra $ 10.00 charge per day..... they offer a great product with the ibis, shame one lame useless charge will make me look else where next time....

Reviews.Title: “Ehh, it's Ok”
Reviews.Author: Jbann79
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but cute. Beds are a little hard and shower stalls are tiny and I am only 5'2" tall. Breakfast was not tasty at all nor did it match the description on the menu. 2 for 1 Key Lime Margaritas are 2 for 1 for a reason, not much alcohol at all! Appetizers were good at night. Overall, it was ok for the price and a very cute resort, but I may spend the extra next time for a decent size shower and better bed.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of amenities”
Reviews.Author: rnjwright
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have been disappointed with a Trip Advisor review. The room was small, which wasn't a problem, but there were absolutely NO amenities. There was no fridge, no microwave, no phone. The shower was extremely small and certainly would not allow for couples showering together. In addition, we were only given 2 bath towels, a bathmat and 1 washcloth. No face towels, etc. There was nowhere to hang your wet items. The Lobby was not handicapped accessible. The resort promised free coffee in the restaurant for guests. However, the coffee was not available on Saturday until 8:00. If you're planning any water excursions, you certainly wouldn't be waiting around until 8:00 am for coffee. There was also a $10 "resort fee" added on, which was not listed in our initial reservation. We travel to Key West annually, and we will definitely look elsewhere in the future.

Reviews.Title: “â€œDid not meet my expectations.â€�”
Reviews.Author: yoyocu
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night in July. On our arrival everything was OK, but when we went to the room we realized we did not have a microwave which was necessary for our babies' milk. We request one and never got it. They called in front of us to the guy responsible for that and he never showed up, so we had to warm the milk with the hot water from the faucet. The rooms are OK for a beach place. The place seems to have been remodeled recently. It is well located at the entrance of Key West and you can anywhere in minutes. They say the hotel in on a beach but they are intracoastal waters and they are a little bit muddy.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Bay Restuarant”
Reviews.Author: aegisprncs
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my lunch break sitting outside in the shade with light breezes. The waitress was on top of everything and the food was good. One friend had a nice chicken caesar and the other had a turkey wrap which they both enjoyed. All in I we enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfy, but bathroom, ok.”
Reviews.Author: Mochasej
Reviews.Content: I did love the view from outside of my hotel room and the bed was clean. I loved the fact I could smell the bleach they used when they cleaned it daily! That just meant they really got into it and killed any germs! All we had to do was air the bleach smell out by opening the sliding door! The bathroom however was not really made for a lady. The shower was too small so to shave was almost impossible. As well, there wasn't any space provided to place your "bathroom necessities." Overall, this was a beautiful, peaceful area. The staff were very considerate, the tiki bar staff was very nice, and the only other thing I would have liked was a shuttle to the beach or Duvel Street so I didn't have to pay the taxi so much each time we went and came back!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Cjporter04
Reviews.Content: Cute room, short drive to duval. Fair price for for the area.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it and will be back!"”
Reviews.Author: Andrea A
Reviews.Content: We stayed during Labor Day Weekend. The employees were great, and were attentive to our needs. The room was great for the price especially since we did not occupy it as much because of all the activities we did during the day. The fun desk was awesome, we were clueless of what activities to do and they recommended some activities which was well worth the price. Thanks Will, you were great from my very first phone call. Housekeeping, cleaned the rooms every day, were prompt & friendly, we requested a blow dryer and it was delivered within 2 mins after the phone call. As for the lighthouse restaurant we ate there twice the breakfast was great!!! Both times we ate there our waitress were attentive, prompt, friendly, and very socially, they made us feel welcomed. Only bad thing was the ice machines were not working. Overall, I would return and recommend this resort, if you're looking for a nice cozy place, for a great rate, good location, and your not planning on staying in the room all day go to the IBIS BAY WATERFRONT RESORT.

Reviews.Title: “Not even close to what was advertised”
Reviews.Author: SaritaM1204
Reviews.Content: Our room was less than adequate from a musty odor, no closet, no hair dryer, no clock radio, no iron, and the worst was the bed! Had to be at least 20 years old and felt like sleeping on two box springs. If the bed would have been decent, the rest could have been tolerable. Needless to say we spent as little time as possible in the room. We didn't even take time to check out the restaurant or pool here. The office staff was nice and helpful but accomodations we received were not what was pictured or advertised when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: 66MaryB
Reviews.Content: This resort has all the things that will make your stay an awesome experience. Water front view is very beautiful and relaxing. Swimming pool and restaurant are really good. Overall a very nice experience. Beware of some wild creatures outside.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a few extra $ for somewhere else to stay”
Reviews.Author: slotboss
Reviews.Content: Lipstick on a pig.....Bright and colorful outside and horrible rooms. Just imagine the cheapest way you could get away with doing a hotel rooms and they have over done themselves. The matress felt like a another box spring. No alarm clock in room. Faded, stained covers on bed, two towels and one wash cloth in bathroom. No closet just coat rack screwed to the wall. Please learn from my mistake and spend a few more dollars and get a real room ANYWHERE else.

Reviews.Title: “Caution”
Reviews.Author: Shells103
Reviews.Content: Property is going through a much needed rehab. Has potential. Furnishings in room was very sparse, had to use a chair as the night stand. Until the amenities are improved would not recomend for a couple. Needs to work on the lighting outside the rooms, had to fumble to get in the door because I could not see. Pool was full of local children, very rowdy and rude. Could not enjoy the pool at all. The restaurant food and drinks were good. Glad they are working on the hotel but chances are I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Place - Last Short Vacation for the kids before the start of School”
Reviews.Author: MasterTravelers
Reviews.Content: Hello again folks - This was a last minute trip and I had remembered seeing the Ibis Resort, with its colorful neon sign, and decided to call. I spoke to a very nice lady who upgraded my room from a regular (hotel style) room to a 2 bedroom suite. The room we booked was #612... remember it... it is right next to the pool and next to the breakfast/bar area. Anyways, we were very pleased when we walked in. The kids attacked the first bedroom and we got the rear one which faced the pool. The rear room has a huge bathroom with a tub and separate shower. The good thing is if you need even more room than this, you can book the ajoining room, which connects (should you have a bigger family). The breakfast is free and great. Not the stuff you get at continental breakfast - what you do is, you print the coupon that is displayed on this page, and when you arrive to check in, you tell the front desk. They will give you a card for at least 4 people for a free hot breakfast, cooked to order.. really a great money saver. The staff at the resturant are attentive... just make sure to take care of your waiter. Danny was a great server as we tried to stay cool in the pool. The day was so hot that it felt like bath water. Danny kept the drinks and eats coming and made our stay great. Also, I strolled within the complex and found Mccaws and turtles. I found hammocks by the beach but the heat was so intense, I couldn't stay long. There are wet bike tours that leave from the property and boat rentals too. Now for the part that need improvements: The Beds!!!!They are too hard, please throw a pillow top on there - it would make for an improved nights sleep. Also the flat screens sit to low. Management should consider setting them up on the walls for greater comfort when watching TV from the beds. Tip: Ask for the renovated rooms only - the non-renovated are cheeper but you will not be happy. Also don't eat at the Hard Rock - it was terrible - no one ate their food and it was $80 bill! Better eats are some of the local seafood resturants and the never failing TGIF and my kids fav. OUTBACK. Happy Travels! From MasterTravelers

Reviews.Title: “DONâ€™T STAY HERE! Spend the extra money for a better experience in Key West.”
Reviews.Author: pancit85
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 6 nights. It was our first time in Key West and everything was great except our stay at the Ibis Resort. When we got to our room we were shocked to find that the comforters and pillows were in a pile on one of the double beds! We had to call the front desk and have housekeeping clean our room for us when that should have already been done prior to our arrival. The room was filthy. The comforters, decorative pillows and shams had stains all over them. It made me question if the sheets on the beds had even been cleaned. I was afraid to touch the comforters because of how dirty they looked. The bathroom was small and definitely smelled of mildew. There were also drain flies in the bathroom. The sliding door only stayed shut with the use of a metal pole. Out of our 6 day stay, our room was only cleaned 3 times. I called the front desk to request fresh towels during one of the days housekeeping skipped our room and a lady came to our door with a trash bag filled with towels, soap and toilet paper. I guess that was supposed to make up for skipping our room that day but I found that to be very rude. THIS IS NOT A RESORT... STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE. The pictures are very misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: Anthony Z
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here on 8-9-11. We started out in an updated room, but didn't really like the view of the rundown boat outside of our room. I went to the front desk and spoke with Alex. He was very helpful in changing our room. We chose to move to one of the older rooms and thought it had great charm and a "cozy" feeling to it. I asked Linda from housekeeping for an iron and ironing board and she was very helpful and friendly also!!!! Very refreshing to have such wonderful and attentive help!!!! We will absolutely stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: klmcs
Reviews.Content: The Ibis Bay is a good value for what we paid. The rooms are clean, beds are comfortable, maid service is very reliable, pool is nice, front desk staff/concierge VERY HELPFUL!!!! Only suggestion - room layout doesn't accomodate a family. No place to hang wet towels in the bathroom (a hanger on the back of the door would be a great addition). Also, had to place our bags on the floor, wasted space in the room that could easily be fised with a luggage rack or longer dresser. Also, ice machine was broken during our stay. WIFE reception VERY WEAK.

Reviews.Title: “4th of July”
Reviews.Author: VickyZ33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ibis Bay during the 4th of July weekend. We were told check-in was at 4pm, but with a little help from the housekeeping crew, we were able to get a room at noon. Our room was a regular hotel room with 2 beds, one dresser and a mirror. It was decorated in blues with that old Key West charm. We thought it was cute and very clean. Our view was great. We had an oceanfront (well, really bayside) room. The beds were next to a glass sliding door and from our bed, we could see the water. When you stepped out, you were on the sand and there were big chairs, umbrellas and hammocks for our use. The only thing I didn't like was the bathroom. It had a blue/green tub and sink from back in the 50s. Although I must say, not all the rooms are this way. During this same trip, my cousin stayed in a 2nd floor unit and his room was totally renovated. We didn't use the pool because we spent our time over by Duval. I did walk over to get ice and it seemed decent-sized and there was a good crowd at the pool bar.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: garaba2
Reviews.Content: Very nice location and we got it for $100 incl taxes. It has a nice restaurant/bar on the beach. Very clean, but has a small bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the value and the tortoise habitat.”
Reviews.Author: Petwriter
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in was old and run down, but there was a note in the room acknowledging that it was old and run down and that the room was an original to Key West and that the hotel was being upgraded. Indeed, the room was about $100 less than the surrounding rooms and the note in the room acknowledged that the price was due to the fact that the room had not been upgraded, which I appreciated. The savvy traveller knows that most hotels do not clean the comforters and that you should never use the comforter and use the blankets instead. Knowing this, I tried calling down the front desk but the phone was not hooked up. So at 9:45 pm I had to go to the front desk and ask for extra blankets. I was told that they would be sent right up. 20 minutes later, using my cell phone, I called to enquire about the blankets but was told they would "get to it." Not wanting to wait up I told them to forget it. Other than that, the pool was lovely, the tortoise habitat was clean and the animals appeared well-fed, there were plenty of watersports available (but the prices are not the best on the Island) and the parrots were in a huge cage. There is a restaurant on the premises, and plenty of places to sit and enjoy the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the front desk stare and you will be fine”
Reviews.Author: Ksmatic
Reviews.Content: I believe staying at any hotel is how the front desk greets you. There were two (Russian) girls working at the front with fury west on the corner to sell you packages which we got. When I first walked in, the fury guy greet us and said hello thinking that was the front desk, he pointed the two girls which were chatting and ignoring us. As we got in front of them, they stared at us like we were in the wrong place. I had to tell them, checking in. They asked for my ID and CC while the other girl stare us down with a rude look that we interupted their important conversation. The room was great, for renovated room, at a buck and a half is decent. Pool is clean that go from 3'6" to 5'. No ice machine, old style tv, restaurant is overpriced. This is a private owned resort so the owner is using his own money to remodel each room, once it's done, the things I've listed should be done. I think service attitude or front desk should be changed or replaced as that's the only reason why I wouldn't stay here again

Reviews.Title: “We will be back to Ibis Bay Resort!”
Reviews.Author: KM2011
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at Ibis Bay Resort! The restaurant was nice as it too is water front. Everyone there is so friendly and helpful to our family! We had a large room with a huge closet, and a very large soaking tub! The view from our room was water front and it was wonderful! The hotel is great for a family as they have all activities right at the resort. Jet skiing, boat trips you name you can do it there!!! We will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay. Any return trips and we'll stay here”
Reviews.Author: JFlynn5
Reviews.Content: Don't see how any one could complain. We got a two double bed on water(Rm 206) . This room was fresh,clean and comfortable with a great view. stayed 4 days and everyday after coming back from beach or where ever room was cleaned and replenished. Very nice pool and restaurant. Staff was very friendly . Hotel is near everything you could want. Tourist section is a mile or so down road but you can rent scooters for 30 dollars a day or do like we did and drive. no problem parking. For the money a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: “Local who loves Ibis!”
Reviews.Author: Bmc2010
Reviews.Content: I live in Key west and visit Ibis on a weekly basis. I love the restaurant and the staff is great. Since they have made renovations to the property and restaurant it is my new Sunday hang out. It all started with the stone crab. During season they have the largest portions and best prices in all of Key West. Ive tried other things on the menu and have always been impressed. The jerk chicken wings are the best wings Ive ever had. One thing we also enjoy is the parrots. They have a HUGH cage and they really add to the atmosphere of the resort. My wife brings grapes to feed the birds every time we come. They have a jet ski tour that leaves from the beach in front of the resort, and there's no better way to see the island than from the water. Its nice to have a resort that takes care of the locals and makes them feel right at home. So if you do decide to stay or eat at Ibis, pull up a bar stool and ask the guy next to you what its like to live here. You will probably hear some great stories and get non-bias recommendations. To all Ibis bay staff, A great Big thank you! especially Lindsey and Ashley!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, great staff, location, location,location”
Reviews.Author: silvervenus1
Reviews.Content: Love the room, (616) simple,yet very well though and decorated, the staff made the stay a great experience, everyone's always ready to help meet your needs. Pool very clean, very inviting, great live music. Turtles give a special touch, very Key West style. Rates very reasonable and not so "turist" oriented, like every other hotel has become in Key West lately.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: Boricua51
Reviews.Content: Passing by to the keys or getting out of the keys staying in Ibis Bay it's ok. Upper rooms are to be remolded badly, the lower level it's best. The pool is good. There's a restaurant but we never went there though there's other establishment around the area maybe next time...

Reviews.Title: “Ten reasons why you should not stay at Ibis Bay Resort”
Reviews.Author: maria_alvarado470
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent seven nights at Ibis Bay Resort ,and it certainly did not fulfill my expectations at all for the following reasons: First, one of the receptionist was uncommunicative. He did not know how to talk or explain things to me. Second, the comforter on my bed was dirty. I myself had to talk to the lobby and make the bed again with a clean one instead of the housekeeper. Third, next day the housekeeper put the same dirty comforter back on my bed. Fourth, the wireless connection was extremelly low. So whenever I had to search something on The Internet, I had to stand right next to the window. Also, the signal from cell phones was low inside the room. I could not get in touch with my relatives in the US or overseas. Fifth, whenever I had to get in touch with the lobby, the telephone did not work. so I had to walk back. the way from my room to the lobby was not well-illuminated and there was a huge container full of trash. Sixth, unfortunately there was no free shuttle to go downtown, so I had to spend a lot of money on transportation. The sad thing is that the hotel right across from Ibis Bay Resort did offer a shuttle. Seventh, I thought the hotel was next to the beach, but actually it is not. So the advertising "Beach Resort"is not reliable either. Eighth, the worst part happened at the resort restaurant. I decided to get a sandwich, and one of the workers complained in front of the rest of the workers because I had not included the tip. I didnot pay for it because it wanted to eat my sandwich in my room since this restaurant is right next to the waterfront and it is full of bugs. The guy literally threw the fries,chicken, lettuce, etc. in the box. it was all messy. He did not say a single word, went back to the kitchen and put the food in order. In my opinion this was totally disrespectful. After that, I went back to the lobby and the receptionist said he was sorry and it was up to me if I wanted to pay a tip or not. Ninth, as a consequence I had to start walking to the supermarket everyday to get some ready-made food.. Tenth, the second day two police cars stayed in the resort for the whole day. Apparently, something was going on on the second floor. Key West receives thousands of visitors from all over the world. The staff at Ibis Bay Resort should get a special training on how to treat guests regardless language, sex, religion, or country of origin. I am an international tourist, and I have been very lucky to travel all over the world. It is a shame how I was treated here.

Reviews.Title: “Just left. Coming back soon!”
Reviews.Author: blbelong
Reviews.Content: Spent this weekend there. Great weekend pool party with a DJ. The pool is catered. We planned on doing lots of things and ended up hanging out at the pool most of the time. Sad to leave;)

Reviews.Title: “Probably the worst hotel in the world!”
Reviews.Author: filgud
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here! It is disgusting. It was an awful experience that I do not recommend even to my worst enemy. It is filthy, the employes are unfriendly and inexperienced and worse of all they are not serious people. I was cheated when making my reservation and led to believe that the room was something completely different than what it ended up being. In the end, me and my wife ended up sleeping in the floor, because there was no room for us and the kids (and we are not fat, at all!!). We complained but they simply did not care. I wish you all a good trip, Filipe

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here when it was Blue Lagoon; major renovation has taken place!”
Reviews.Author: bpdubs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for two nights this past weekend. We had stayed here last year when it was the Blue Lagoon. It really was not my first choice of places to stay for this weekend because we wanted to be in Old Town and at a nicer place. However, I had a tough time finding B & B's in town with (1) vacancies (2) no 3-night minimum and (3) somewhat reasonable rates. So, I turned to Blue Lagoon as a last resort, and was surprised to see that after years and years, it had a new identity: Ibis Bay. When we stayed at Blue Lagoon last year, it was cheap and had a huge pool, but not remotely impressive. The bed was awful, the linens cheap, the lighting in the room almost nonexistent, and just generally, trashy. What a difference a year has made. -The staff are cleaner.
