Last year the front desk guy was kind of scuzzy and uncommunicative. This year, they're in uniforms and are pleasant and helpful. -The lobby is no longer dark and dingy. It's bright and happy and Key Westy. -The exteriors have all been painted and are really cute. -The waterfront area, including the areas around 600 rooms, has been cleaned up significantly with new sand added. -The rooms - wow, what a difference. Our room had clean, white beadboard wainscotting with blue walls. The bathroom had expensive-looking blue glass tiles around the sink, which had new fixtures. The bed was awesome - king size, comfortable, with tons of pillows and high quality linens. I recognized the end tables from Ikea - simple, but they did the job. We also had a decent-size flatscreen tv, which was nice when we wanted to nap before going on. The window treatments were even nicely done. As for decor, they got rid of that stale, floral-print old motel stuff - no tacky pastel sunset paintings or anything like that. Instead, they had vibrantly colored, retro-style travel posters framed on the wall and a nice navy blue and white duvet. The remodel was really well done. -There were also plastic adirondack chairs in front of our room, which was nice when we wanted to have a beer before going out. The negative: -It would have been really nice to have a small refrigerator in our room. On our last day, I saw a small fridge, microwave and coffeemaker sitting outside the room next to us, as though they were going in. -We didn't use the pool area because there were just too many kids in it. I work with kids; I don't need to hang around them on vacation! Obviously, this is not the hotel's fault, but something that visitors to Key West should keep in mind - this hotel may attract more families than typical Key West lodging. -You have to take a cab (or drive. But who wants to drive in Key West?) to get to Old Town. -The parking lot still kind of sucks. We got blocked in the parking lot by a delivery truck at the restaurant one day. Also, they still have parking down by the rooms facing US-1 - a huge Chevy Tahoe was parked 6-feet in front of our room for our stay in a legit parking space. I don't know why they need to use those spaces. It would be nice for room 606 and the room next to it not to have other people's cars at their doorstep. I'm not sure what some of the people reviewing here are talking about, re: disgusting rooms and no phones. Our room had a phone and it was totally clean. Maybe all of the rooms haven't been remodeled? I don't know. But it's a decent buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: “MOTEL NOT HOTEL!!!GHETTO IN WATTS IS BETTER!!”
Reviews.Author: chewbacca3
Reviews.Content: I am currently sitting here in a room that has maybe a 20 or so inch screen...not flat....one dining room chair...two beds one of which moves because it has wheels...the bathroom is so darn small a full of mold and shower stains on the tub as if you left a shampoo bottle there for years and the hard water stained it...the shower knobs are worn down as if they have been sitting in sea water for years....the sliding glass door does not slide....the air was totally off so the room was musty and hot....no head boards.....I could have done better in a freakin shack!!! There are stains all over the counter top, the little bit that is there in the little bathroom......oh and the kicker I was told we had parking in front of our room....nope not true!!! They were all handicap!!!!!!! Thanks....we have a lot of crap since we did south beach first and came over here....oh and don't be fooled by "WATER FRONT" VIEWS!!! I totally not worth the extra money!! This totally SUCKS, SUCKS, SUCKS!! Worst room I have ever stayed in thanks Crap IBIS MOTEL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “ibis resort keep on driving !”
Reviews.Author: fisherguide
Reviews.Content: We were bumped from the double tree - 19 of our Jupiter seahawk 10 under and 12 under girls to the Ibis for a tournament against the lady conchs . The rooms were dirty - some unfinished - staff were hard to deal with mostly russian / euro type . the dJ on saturday afternoon invited 6 strippers to the pool for a show in front of the young girls coming off a a game . disgusting place manager did nothing to stop or did they care . the double tree refunded half of our money - they were great to deal with and quite embarrassed .

Reviews.Title: “Buyers Beware... AWFUL. Dirty, clogged bathtub overflowed, got handed a plunger to fix it .”
Reviews.Author: missyboo94
Reviews.Content: Most awful experience ever . Dirty rooms , no furniture, clogged bathroom drain which caused bathtub to overflow. Had to get out of shower with soap in hair to go tell lobby because their are no phones in rooms. Then wait an hour for someone to come knock on the door to hand me a plunger to fix my own bathtub. Spent a total of 3 hrs before becoming fed up and leaving. Do yourself a favor and avoid this place . Price is enticeing but don't be fooled like us . Almost ruined our vacation. Run ......

Reviews.Title: “Value”
Reviews.Author: canes73
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel & great location to shops & restaurants. Great place to watch the sunset. Minutes from shops &restaurants. For $99 a night not bad at all that meant more money for you to have a good time. The rooms are very beach like. You can watch the sunset or have a drink at the bar. The bed is alright & I bathroom is fine too enough to get clean up.

Reviews.Title: “Cute & quirky, but spartan”
Reviews.Author: MrValiant
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight while our home was getting fumigated for termites. Rooms were cute & clean, but hardly any furniture. The only place to store clothes was a small low table that had baskets in the only shelf. No desk, couch or closet. It was fine for overnight, but would not want to spend a week there. Restaurant is good and on site, but the main part of Key West (Duval Street) is about a mile away, so you'd have to take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to relax yet close to all activities”
Reviews.Author: rayjo17
Reviews.Content: We decided to come to Key West with another couple for a three days Memorial Day weekend. We didn't ask for side by side rooms but the office made that arrangement which was awesome. They help us book an electric car, parasailing and a sunset dinner cruise. The pool and restaurant were very nice. Food was delicious. The rooms were adorable. No place to unpack but for a couple of days it was no big deal. The only negative was that our rooms were not made up the second day we were there. We had to find the cleaning lady to get clean towels. But as the say in the Keys, â€œrelaxâ€� so we werenâ€™t stressed about it. We got our towels, took showers and were off to a wonderful night downtown. We are from South Florida and we would definitely stay there again. A great deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Pay more and stay at a nicer hotel so you can enjoy your trip more”
Reviews.Author: SunnyFaceTraveler
Reviews.Content: PROS: 1. Nice staff, very helpful and responsive 2. Location was nice and it was pretty quiet CONS: 1. It is a motel, basically 2. The rooms are about 400 sq ft and they have no amenities 3. Small bathrooms really suck 4. It is nowhere near worth 200/night...70 maybe but not more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: JoeyNaples
Reviews.Content: What a great time my wife and myself had at Ibis Bay. I am a DJ in the Florida Keys and had to attend the Singers, Songwriters Fest in Key West. Decided to stay just out of downtown for some relaxation. What a place!! The rooms were great, the restaurant was spectacular and everyone that worked there was so kind and helpful. I could not believe the food and the reasonable prices. My compliments to the Chef. I am in Key West quite often and look forward to staying again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nikkiigrl_21
Reviews.Content: My friend and I drove 28 hours from wisconsin to come visit Keywest. The minute we check into the Ibis Bay it was great. We had a ocean front room and it was awesome. The room was very clean and super cute! All the staff were super friendly,helpful,and fun.I would totally come back again,and hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great food and A good Time”
Reviews.Author: dewcam
Reviews.Content: Room was Rustic and clean The Pool was clean and very nice Ate for meals at the restaurant all where excellent and the price was right Can wait to come back thanks to the staff

Reviews.Title: “Keep Driving!”
Reviews.Author: MsEFortWayne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stopped by the Ibis Bay Resort on a recent trip to Key West, as we needed lodging for the last few days of our stay. The outside, pool and restaurant area looked fairly nice, so we booked two nights. When we checked in a few days later and were given our room key, what a shock! The room was old and dirty looking. Old tile floors, desperately needing cleaned and grouted, rusty bathroom plumbing, dated fixtures very sparse lighting, the only furniture, besides two mattresses and boxrsprings, were plastic patio tables that held a TV that displayed a snowing picture on every channel. No place to place your luggage or clothes, no coffee pot, no tissues, the wall air conditioner was very noisy. We tried to cancel the second night, but they would not refund the $200.00, so we stuck it out. It was awful!!

Reviews.Title: “False advertisement equals awful experience.”
Reviews.Author: elfy8884
Reviews.Content: If you think this is a reasonably priced hotel, think twice. The website faulty advertises a nice luxury room. If you notice all the pictures on the site, is of the same exact room. My boyfriend and I were in Key West for a wedding, and thought this was a nice place. You walk in to the room, where there is NO chairs, no closet, no working TV, no iron, no fridge, an ice bucket, that you cant even fill because there is no ice machine. After returning from the wedding off property, I called the front desk to ask where i can get some water because all the vending machines were completely empty of anything to drink. The front desk person told me at 12 something at night they were out of water "you can walk to the gas station across the street" in a heavy accent. I then asked to speak to a manager, and he yelled at me, " dont threaten me! i know scare tactics" ....i am still appalled, and dont know how to react to this. Also, since the restaurant and bar was closed i still needed water. The next day we took a walk in the back of all the rooms and realized EVERY room had 2 complimentary bottles of water. We had none. I think about letting the Key west Bureau of tourism know about this, among a few other things that were not at all appropriate at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, relaxing slice of paradise!!!”
Reviews.Author: Adventure4Five
Reviews.Content: Some of the reviews on this site had me worried, but the moment we arrived at Ibis Bay I knew we were in paradise. We checked in at 6 pm, and immediately Chris, the owner, offered to give us a ride downtown for the sunset celebration so that we didn't have to worry about finding parking. On the way down to Mallory Square, he pointed out various things to do and places that had good music and food. (All good recommendations, by the way...thanks!) Over the next few days, Chris would stop at our table at breakfast time and ask how our trip was going and make some more suggestions on things we might enjoy. Ana and Misty at the Fun Desk answered all of our questions about the different activities available on Key West, and helped us set up a moped rental and a snorkel/sunset cruise. We also did the jetski tour around the island, which was great. Our guides were friendly and funny, and everyone in our group (even the inexperienced riders) had a great time. I know that not all of the rooms are finished being renovated yet, but our room was beautiful and looked just like the picture on the hotel website. The bathroom (shower only) was bright and very roomy. We had a waterfront room and spent a lot of time laying in the hammocks or sitting on the bench enjoying the warm sand on our toes and cool breeze off the water. Wireless didn't reach the bayfront room but was available in the restaurant and lobby, as well as some of the outside areas. We ate breakfast in the Lighthouse Restaurant twice, and it was delicious and very reasonably priced. The one time we ate dinner there the service was a little slow, but the food was wonderful and they had good live music playing so we just sat back and enjoyed ourselves. I am pretty sure that this is the first vacation I have ever really relaxed on, and I owe a lot of that to Ibis Bay. Instead of stressing out about how to entertain ourselves the whole time we just went with the flow. Chris said he is working on setting up a website that will help customize your vacation before you even check in, and I can't wait to see the results. He also said he is going to try to keep the cost down (we paid $149 for a waterfront queen! In Key West!) and I am just praying he is able to do that with all of the improvements he is planning. Honestly, my only complaint about this place was that they were out of size small t-shirts. I enjoyed my stay so much that I literally started crying when we drove past the "now leaving Key West" sign, and the first thing I did when I got home was put $20 in and envelope labled "Ibis Bay 2012." We will definitely be back. And if you read this guys, we promise not to lose our room key next time!

Reviews.Title: “Solid but Unspectacular Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kaze16
Reviews.Content: A good overall experience, but not a perfect one. Considering other hotel prices, it's a great value for the price. High/Low-lights: - Great pool - Restaurant/bar by the pool was convenient and very good - Service was hit or miss - great at the bar and 'fun desk' but cold and slow at front desk - The room was basic, but had everything we need - There are a couple caged parrots on the property - nice to look at but squak VERY loudly beginning early in the morning. We were woken up before 6 by them several times - request a room away from them - The hotel location is a bit outside the main drag of Key West, but nothing is too far on the island and it was easy to call a cab - even walkable if you're up for it - Fun Desk was great - good suggestions for things to do and helpful in scheduling - Free wireless had ok speed/connectivity

Reviews.Title: “Drove 17 hours and our room was given to someone else”
Reviews.Author: NCFamilyfun
Reviews.Content: Arrived to the Ibis and was told by a rude "Russian" man that our room we booked was not available. I had a confirmation and deposit. We reserved a unit with three beds for myself & wife, and 2 teenage boys. We were offered an "upgrade" with a possible cot added. We walked into a small apartment with a parking lot view. The unit looked like a frat house. You walked into a small room with futon, then stairs up to a fullsize bed and bath. This was not a resort, it was a bad apartment complex. We went back and said this would not work and wanted our room. We were told it was not available. I asked for a credit of my card and went to Parrot Key-more money, but well worth it. We did not receive our credit for 7 days. Our local guide said Ibis has been trying to clean up units. Start with the staff-work on not overbooking, a smiling staff, a personality, etc. You could have ruined our vacation, and did not even care.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: wendinmikey
Reviews.Content: So to start check-in was horrible they couldn't get the credit card machine to work must have took 20 minutes to check in with no one else waiting. You have to sign a checklist of all these fees if you do something like lose your key. (Apparently they only have 1 key to the room HA!) They say if you lose your key they will charge you $85 for a locksmith to replace the lock. So we go to our room and it is nice that they painted but they didn't air out the room at all. We smelled paint so strong for the 2 days we were there. The room was tiny, basically all they could fit in there was a king bed and a tiny table. There was no alarm clock, hair dryer, coffee maker, ice bucket, luggage stand wifi only at the bar, refrigerator, microwave, or even a tub, small stand up shower only. The bathroom in general was so small I could practically put my arms out and reach both walls give or take a foot. Thankfully the AC was loud so our baby could sleep otherwise we would have heard loud and clear the drunken music playing at the bar. Also the live music that was there my husband and I thought it was karaoke it was so bad. The bed was hard and not that comfortable the comforter had stains and rough spots as well. We had a small window but you couldn't really open the blinds because people walking by all the time could see right in your room. The service at the restaurant the 1st night was very slow and we were with a wedding which pretty much took up the whole hotel and they only gave 1 waitress to about 40 of us. The food at the restaurant was pretty bad we had dinner and breakfast there and it was average at best. The fruit bowl was warm and tasted spoiled as well. We chose to do to Denny's the next day. They have a little sandy area that has a turtle fenced in that I thought was rather sad. They also have a giant cage with parrots as well. The customer service over all was horrible. We even got to see the honeymoon suite that our friends were staying in and it was huge but kind of disgusting. The refrigerator was old and rusted like it had been left outside for years and they had a sign posted on the ac that you couldn't put the air lower than 75 because it would freeze up. So the bride and groom had to go buy fans for the room and the groom was sweating like crazy the day of the wedding because it was so hot in there. The pictures online are seriously misleading the rooms look pretty with the new paint and the TV but that is about it. Not to mention the TV only had 6 channels and they were all local ones. For a little more money you can stay at the Marriott right next door and you know what you are getting with the big chain. All the advertisements for this hotel are misleading. It is more a motel, we didn't see any spa, there is no wifi, or cable in the rooms. Absolutely worst stay at any hotel we have ever been to. Don't stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lighthouse Restaurant - Avoid - poor service”
Reviews.Author: TJinKW
Reviews.Content: I am a local and had been eager to try the new restaurant - I believe it is called the Lighthouse restaurant- attached to the Ibis Bay resort. I tried finding the restaurant to do a separate review, but it is not listed separately. My husband and I hopped into the restaurant for a nice relaxing lunch one afternoon. The restaurant had plenty of seating and was not too busy. It is a seat yourself restaurant, which may be part of the problem we had. After we sat down, it took about 15 minutes for anyone to even notice us, even though the tables around us were being served. Finally a a waitress comes over and takes our drink order, 2 ice teas, then disappears. We wait again for another 5 to 10 minutes until a very nice, large man comes over and asked if we had been helped yet. We tell him someone took our drink order but that was a long time ago and nothing since. We didn't even have place settings yet or menus. He says something about a change of shift and the waiters and waitresses were confused or struggling to figure out which tables they had, really?! Finally a new waiter comes out with our drink order and menus, then he too disappears. 30 minutes into this visit and he had menus and 2 ice teas. We would have left, but I guess we are just too nice to up and leave, plus we had nothing better to do than enjoy each others company and relax. This whole time 2 tables next us have their waitresses hovering over them and are never gone more than 5 minutes. Of course both of these tables had about 5 or 6 people at them so I am assuming the better service was because of the expected larger tip... Our waiter comes back and we order the Peanut butter and bacon sandwich, a turkey sandwich and a house salad. Poof, he is gone again. We don't see him again until our salad is delivered 20 minutes later, the rest of the food followed about 15 minutes later. We couldn't help but notice that people on the other side of the restaurant that sat down after us had already had their food and were about to pay by the time our food started to arrive! The waiter was very abrupt and borderline rude. When we finally got our sandwiches and were eating, the waiter did come over once to check on my husband, completely ignoring me. He looked right at him and said, "How is your sandwich sir? Can I get you anything else?" I just looked at my husband like, really? Our ketchup bottle on our table was empty, and when mentioning it to the waiter he was like, okay, what do you want me to do about it, grabbed a ketchup bottle of another table and left the empty one for the next table to have nothing... Only after our meal was done and we gave our credit card and local ID card to the waiter was he friendly and conversational, almost too conversational like trying to make up for the bad service kind of chummy! We arrived a little before 2p and didn't get out of there until after 4p - 2 hours for ice tea and sandwiches! Service was very disappointing. The food; however, was okay. Nothing spectacular, limited menu selection and a bit on the pricey side. Better sandwiches can be made at home. I do not plan on going back unless I am dragged back and have a LOT of time kill!

Reviews.Title: “Janie at the front desk was not telling the TRUTH.”
Reviews.Author: gp0621
Reviews.Content: We drove into Key West stopped by the Welcome Center and Shane booked our reservation to stay at this place (disgusting). We were confirmed at $159 rate per night. Ten minutes later when we arrived this young woman with a Russian accent (?) said the room rate was $229 and we could not view the room before giving over our credit card???? I spoke with another clerk (guy with Russian accent) and he was more amenable. Do not stay in this place keep driving into Key West and you will find much better, cleaner accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Winter wonderland”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkNewYork212
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the Keys. I stayed in one of the other Keys on my last visit and found it less desirable than Key West. When looking for a place to stay the week, I found Ibis Bay. The colorful decor and welcoming staff made it an easy choice. I spent most of my time in the resort- swimming at the pool, riding the waverunners and feeding the parrots. The restaurant is a great place to sit, relax and get some great American finger-lickin' good food. The buffalo wings- served in a bag- are a must have! For dessert don't pass up the frozen hot chocolate. It is worth the calories! At night, we sat at the bar for some cocktails and listened to an amazing musician. No need to travel to the strip and fight the drunken hordes of people! Our room was tastefully decorated- blues and white- nautical themed room. The room overlooked the bay- a great view during the sunset. This resort is a perfect place to hang out with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: envfocus
Reviews.Content: My wife, son (16 yrs old), and I stayed at the Ibis for 4 nights. I echo what another reviewer said, which is that if you are looking for luxury, do not stay here, but if you are looking for a quiet, clean place to stay, then consider the Ibis. This was formerly the "Blue Lagoon Sports Motel" which I was told had a spotty reputation. New owners are trying to change this back to a value place to stay and I think they are succeeding. Our room was small/spartan, but it was clean, freshly painted, and served as a great starting and ending point for our stay. We did not want to spend a lot of money on our hotel since we planned on being out most of the time. The Ibis fit that bill. You can wake up, walk to their patio/outdoor bar/restaurant and get a great latte for $2.50 and breakfast that is reasonably priced, then go downtown to enjoy Key West. The pros of the Ibis were the cost (and free parking), location, cleanliness, and quiet. Cons were the somewhat loud AC unit, waterfront (which is just a man-made bay with rocky shoreline), and small size of the room. The support staff were all kind, but we did have to ask for items that we had requested in our reservation, like a refrigerator and hair dryer. We also asked for a microwave, but we never got one, but that was OK because I'm not sure where it would have fit into our room. Another pro was that across the street is a large grocery store/pharmacy. It also has a nice salad/fruit/soup bar so if you want to save some money, you can make yourself a big salad to go. I would recommend a waterfront room. Being able to open the sliding door and sit outside made the room seem larger and more private. We never used the pool even though it looked great. We only ate breakfast there, so I can't comment on dinner but they did have live entertainment when we returned from our days out. I was concerned with possible noise (neighbors, live music, street noise), but that was never a problem. Also, there is not bathtub, just a shower which is fine for us, but may be important to you. Not to be rude, but one of my criteria for an OK bathroom is if I can sit on the toilet and close the door without hitting my legs. You can. Still, the bathroom is small, but servicable. All in all, the Ibis is more like a motel than a hotel, giving you the basics. But if you are looking for a reasonably priced place to use as a starting point, then I would recommend adding this to your list of possible places to stay. Outside of the Ibis, we drove into town each day (less than 5 minute drive). If you are going to spend all day downtown, then use the city's parking ramp at the corner of Grinnell and Caroline. Thirteen dollars for covered parking that's located right at the beginning of the boardwalk. If you want to park for free, then we found we could still find places a few blocks off of Duval Street (the main street in town) if we got downtown by 9 am. Key West doesn't seem to wake up until 10:30ish so finding a spot wasn't hard for us. We would recommend going to Ft. Zachary State Park. Great snorkling, swimming, eating (picnic tables in the shade), restrooms, and you can see the sunset without the crowds (I included a picture). Seven dollars gets a car in for the entire day. You can leave and reenter that day as long as you save your receipt. Finally, we did a 4-hour snorkling/lunch trip with Capt Alex (Islescapes). It was great. Just my family, Capt Alex and his first mate. We had lunch on the beach of an island about 10 miles offshore that we basically had to ourselves. Capt Alex will make whatever you request for lunch. Snorkling was great by a lighthouse around 9 miles offshore then we snorkled by a sunken pirate ship nearer to the Keys. It was about $450, but if you can afford it, we'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Bay - I loved my stay!”
Reviews.Author: KdgTeacherYLS
Reviews.Content: My firends and I were looking for somewhere to get away for our Midwinter break from teaching and this was the perfect place. The staff was so helpful and went above and beyond to accommodate us. As soon as we arrived, we had little to no wait before we checked into our Suite. The food at the restaurant was delilsh - and the drinks were great too! I particularly enjoyed the live music that played each night. By far, the jetski rental (which is available at the resort) was amazing. Even though I had a very hard time controling my jet ski, the tour guide was very friendly and didn't make me feel like a complete moron for not knowing how to control my jet/boat ski. As a matter of fact, I was able to sit back while he did all of the driving. It was awesome! My friends and I plan to make this trip a yearly thing and we will definitely make Ibis Bay our resort of choice.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE DISSAPOINTMENT!”
Reviews.Author: kimlopez23
Reviews.Content: We booked this tip n the internet so BUYER BEWARE!!!! Their website showed beautiful rooms. When we got there NOT SO MUCH. We wanted a waterfront place so our teenage daughters could sit on the beach. "BEACH" consists of about 4 feet of rocks and litter. Before we discovered this, at the front desk, we inquired about oour daugher having her wedding there. We were told "Misty" would be in touch with us. Three visits later to the lobby, and no call from the ubiquitous "Misty" or her presence...A Phantom Employee??? If so good name. the restaurant was decent, however I have diabetic issues and the server did not speak enough english to understand me! We will go elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Potential for the resort, but untrained staff and incompetent management will do it in.”
Reviews.Author: Adah85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ibis Bay in February 2011. We booked through Expedia, and the hotel was unable to accomadate our reservation. Apparently the suite we reserved through Expedia did not even exist - the manager was using it as an apartment. The staff put us up in a regular room, but seemed shocked and confused when we asked if we'd get a refund for the price difference, since we'd reserved a suite. They were unable to give a refund, and we were told we'd have to come back when the manager was in. We arrived in the room. There was a cluster of someone else's hair in the sheets when we turned back the bedcovers. The room was bare bones, without even a working telephone or alarm clock, and tile floors. Almost none of the features listed on Expedia were actually available - no wireless internet, premium cable channels, etc. Wireless internet was available in the restaurant only. We eventually did get moved to a suite, and our refund for the first night consisted of a gift certificate to the restaurant. The suite also did not have a working telephone. Don't stay here if you expect to maintain communications with the outside world, or even a wakeup call! The restaurant itself has potential, but is extremely understaffed and undersupplied. We ate there for at least one meal a day out of convenience, and the kitchen was almost always unable to fill and order for one reason or another. If you eat here, don't get things that are supposed to be local specialites - these were almost always the worst things on the menu. The peel and eat shrimp and the stone crab claws were especially bad. The steak, the lobster ravioli, and the sandwiches were almost always good. Breakfast was reliable and tasty. The restaurant has live music every night, which added to the atmosphere. However, the overworked staff is mostly harried, and you'll be waiting a long time for a server to notice you, or to bring you your check at the end of the meal. There is no shuttle to downtown, but the staff at the front desk was helpful in procuring bicycle rentals. It is an easy 2-3 mile bike ride to the popular tourist destinations. The pool was clean and nice. Hammocks overlooking the ocean were a nice touch, and there were jet ski rentals available on site.

Reviews.Title: “The Best New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: spilledrice
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed 2 days. The staff went out of their way to be helpful, especially Laz at the front desk. He went above and beyond helping us. We partied in the patio bar and staff was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “BUDGET TRAVELERS”
Reviews.Author: bikerchic4884
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed for 4 nights, we had a waterfront room, very clean and quite however when you walk out the sliding glass door in the morning it has a foul odor. There was not a coffee maker in the room. The restaurant was good. It did not have a shuttle to downtown. The pool was great. If you are looking for luxuary this is not the place. If you are going to Key West on a budget this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Even though they are remodeling, it was a very nice stay and a great value”
Reviews.Author: keywestgator
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent - right on the water, less than 5 minutes to anywhere you want to go. Not in the thick of tourist chaos. Beautiful view of the ocean. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room decorated very "islandy". They apparently aren't finished furnishing but we didn't care. It was quiet, the staff very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again. And lots of parking in a town where parking is scarce and expensive (25 cents for 10 minutes on the meters!)

Reviews.Title: “Relax...No Panic”
Reviews.Author: Tyson20
Reviews.Content: My day started bad and only got worse. However, when I arrived at Ibis Bay and Laz greeted me with warmth and professionalism like no other. I knew then to "Relax, No Panic" Laz was most helpful. His knowledge of Key West gave me a sence of peace. I knew I could ask him where to go and where not to go and he would be truthful. When I checked in I noticed the bed mattress was a little questionable, so back down to the front desk I travel and like an angel. Laz helped me by moving me to a different room with a better mattress. Overall, the stay was excellent. They could definately use some new mattress' but other than that....GREAT. Thanks Laz. Because of you I will return again. Sincerely, Tyson

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy with our stay, the staff was wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: sweetevy
Reviews.Content: Have a friend that stays on naval base. She was trying to help us find a motel that wouldn't charge us an arm and leg but still be nice and comfortable. She told us about the Ibis. We had remembered it when it was Blue Lagoon, and we wouldn't stay at it before because it was so run down. But we stayed there for a week Jan 9-14. We couldn't have been treated any better. the staff was wonderful and went out of their way to make us feel comfortable. The newly renovated room was very nice. We had ocean view. Housekeepers was so good to us, made sure we had all the amenities we needed. Hauled our Harley down on our dully truck and was able to park both of them at our door. We had checked other places and it was double to three times what we paid at Ibis. For the money, you can't beat it. They are still working to make it even better, and I am sure by next year we will be able to see more changes. We hope to get back next year and will definately stay here. With the money we saved here, we were able to eat out more and do more shopping, which was a big plus. Overall we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Even though renovating, the accomodations, staff, and location was very enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: OldsmarCleanair
Reviews.Content: I have been to this facility previously and am very impressed with what they are doing as far as the renovations and upgrades they have and are making. The staff was very efficient and very accommodating and the services were very good. Food there was great and the entertainment fitting to Key West. I would recommend this facility to anyone who travels to Key West! Jeff B Hoy

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend until they change the mattresses.”
Reviews.Author: SandnSun67
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel thru a book we found at another hotel. We thought we would try it since it was priced right and we only needed one night's stay. The lobby was kind of difficult to find until you know where to look for it. Three other cars passed the lobby up as we were heading back to what looked like the office. The young lady in the front office was being trained by one of the longer term gentleman. Both were quite nice and friendly. We checked in and proceeded to get unloaded for the night. Upon entering the room we quickly noticed there was no closet for storage, no refrigerator, no luggage rack to put luggage on, no coffeemaker, no iron, ironing board, or hair dryer. The room was quite attractive, otherwise. Paint was very nice, tile floor very nice, the 3D lizard on the bathroom wall was priceless! The room has a lot of potential. We showered and turned in to find out the bed feeled like the springs were about to poke thru the mattress. I've been on some bad mattresses in my short life, but this one was the worst one I can remember. They were either quite old or extremely cheap mattresses. We pulled the cover back to check it out and the mattress didn't look old. My wife called the desk to see if we might be able to sacrifice the view of the bay for a more comfortable bed. They were very accomodating and we loaded up in preparation to move to a more comfortable room. Laz greeted me at the office and thought it would be wise to check out the mattress at 401 since they were newer. Bad news was that the mattress was the same as the one we left in the 200 building. We tried one more in the 500 building by the live band and it was slightly better, but still not what is expected. Laz was very professional and seemed to be committed to satisfying the customer (the other gentleman seemed aggravated at the attempt to help us out, but I neglected to get his name). I appreciate that and the fact that he understood where I was coming from. We ultimately opted to check out and try our luck elsewhere so we could find a bed that was comfortable enough to sleep in. The price of the hotel was competitive for the area and the holiday week, but for that kind of money we expected much more. The term "resort" in the name is a bit misleading and until the mattresses are upgraded and until the rooms get the normal amenities (luggage rack, coffee maker, iron, etc.) I hesitate to recommend it. The place has a ton of potential and I hope the owner rethinks the beds and amenities quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience--great value, accommodating service, clean!”
Reviews.Author: bbrigman
Reviews.Content: Since most of the motels in Key West are at $200+ per night, this was a refreshing change. The room was clean and comfortable. The manager was very attentive to our requests for items and went out of his way to assure that our needs were met. We will definitely stay here again if in Key West in the future! Thank you, Laz!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay I've had in Key West.”
Reviews.Author: carolDIA
Reviews.Content: I visit the Keys for work a couple times a year, and this year found this hotel had been completely transformed into a gorgeous sparkling new spot with a clean warm pool and a nice on site restaurant. Most hotel stays are forgettable, but Ibis Bay was unique (complete with local wildlife!), warm, very clean and comfortable, friendly, and restful at the end of the day. It's the best expression of Key West style, I will recommend it to my colleagues and I would definitely stay here for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but problems.....”
Reviews.Author: msryan2u
Reviews.Content: Moved three times to get a room that was somewhat habitable. First one, AC sounded like a train coming through the room. Room number two there was a hole in one of the beds Yes, a hole, about 2ft by 2ft and all the way to the box springs. Room number three HAD been recently renovated, which accounted for the smell of paint that permeated the room. We stayed in the third for two days. Never had enough towels even though the reservations were made for three people. The place sucked.....

HotelInfo.Name: Ibis Bay Waterfront Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 3101 N Roosevelt Blvd, Key West, FL 33040
